properties.areaDesc: Waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR from 10 to 60 nm; Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Gale Watch issued January 13 at 2:07AM PST until January 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Hazardous Seas Warning, combined wind wave and
lowering swell will create very steep and hazardous seas around
15 to 18 ft at 12 seconds. Seas will subside but remain steep
at 10 to 14 ft at 13 seconds for the small craft advisory
conditions on Tuesday. For the Gale and Hazardous seas Watch,
south winds 30 to 40 kt with gusts up to 45 kt beyond 9 NM and
seas 13 to 18 ft at 14 seconds possible.

* WHERE...All areas for the Hazardous Seas Warning and later the
Small Craft Advisory. For the Gale Watch, all areas beyond 9 NM,
Hazardous Seas Watch for the remaining inner waters.


* WHEN...For the Hazardous Seas Warning, until 1 AM PST Tuesday.
For the Small Craft Advisory, from 1 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST
Wednesday. For the Gale Watch, from Wednesday morning through
Wednesday evening. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, from
Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds and very steep seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Low visibility conditions are expected.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid strong winds and
very steep seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course,
and/or secure the vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...GALE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING
